name: 25 Tough Questions about The Mystery of Edwin Drood

questions.text: In what country does the show take place?
questions.explanation:
England.

	It takes place in London to be exact.

questions.text: Who is the first person the chairman calls during "There You Are"?
questions.explanation:
Angela.

	The chairman is Mr. Bill Carthwright.

questions.text: Who wrote the book on which the musical is based?
questions.explanation:
Charles Dickens & Dickens.

	This was the last book that Charles Dickens wrote. He died before he finished, which is why the audience votes on the ending.

questions.text: Complete the lyrics from "A Man Could Go Quite Mad". "A sculptor lacking ________?"
questions.explanation:
arms.

	This is the first song that the villain John Jasper sings. John Jasper is played by Clive Paget.

questions.text: Who plays Edwin Drood?
questions.explanation:
Alice Nutting.

	Alice Nutting is London's leading male personator.

questions.text: Who plays Helena Landless?
questions.explanation:
Janet Conover.

	Helena's twin brother is Neville Landless.

questions.text: Who plays Neville Landless?
questions.explanation:
Victor Grinstead.

	Neville Landless has a temper problem and has been entrusted to the care of the kindly Reverend Chrisparkle.

questions.text: What does Rosa fear according to the song she sings with Helena and the two other girls?
questions.explanation:
the moonfall.

	Everything but Jasper is mentioned in the "Moonfall Quartet" and Jasper is what the words all refer too. She also says that Jasper frightens her before the song starts.

questions.text: According to "The Wages of Sin" what doesn't pay?
questions.explanation:
crime.

	Princess Puffer was played by Angela Prysock.

questions.text: What is Jasper mixing with wine these days?
questions.explanation:
opium.

	He's drinking laudanum wine which causes his hallucinations of him killing his nephew Edwin Drood.

questions.text: Who was originally scheduled to play Mayor Sapsea?
questions.explanation:
James Hitchens.

	Hitchens was off drunk somewhere and never showed up so the chairman had to take on the part of the mayor.

questions.text: What does the chairman find confusing?
questions.correct: Playing both the chairman and the mayor
options: Why people often pick Helena and Neville as the lovers
Why everyone is in love with Rosa Bud
questions.explanation:
Playing both the chairman and the mayor.

	The chairman and Clive sing "Two Sides of the Coin".

questions.text: Nick Cricker gives a cue for a song too early. Which song was it?
options: No Good Can Come from Bad
questions.explanation:
Off to the Races.

	"Steady on, Bill, we don't want these people leaping to conclusions without all the facts at hand. Otherwise, they'll all be running: Off to the races!"

questions.text: When Jasper is in the graveyard, how many footsteps do we hear?
questions.explanation:
It varies.

	Jasper is trying to recreate a scene, and he forgets how many footsteps there were. He thinks he has taken the right number of steps, then hears another and has to cover it up.

questions.text: Why don't Edwin and Rosa want to get married?
questions.correct: They don't know how they feel about each other
options: Edwin is in love with Helena
Rosa is in love with John Jasper
questions.explanation:
They don't know how they feel about each other.

	In "Perfect Strangers" they sing about how they might love each other if they were strangers, but since they were promised at birth they never had the chance to see how they truly do feel.

questions.text: Who is in love with Rosa's mother?
questions.explanation:
Rev. Crisparkle

	In "No Good Can Come from Bad" Rev. Crisparkle sings, "In younger days, I hungered for another: Rosa's mother!"

questions.text: What is the name of the play that Bazzard wrote?
questions.explanation:
The Thorn of Anxiety.

	"The Thorn of Anxiety" is a tragedy and will never be performed.

questions.text: Who did Bazzard play in "Julius Caesar"?
questions.explanation:
a senator.

	Chairman: "Well at least you were in for the kill."

questions.text: Fill in the blank from "Never the Luck". "I'll __________ my way into your heart."
questions.explanation:
waltz.

	Philip Bax who played Bazzard sings this song. I should note at this point, this is a play within a play. The people I'm telling you played the parts are not the actors, but the parts the actor played who plays the other part.

questions.text: What is the name of the detective in "Private Investigation"?
questions.explanation:
Dick Datchery.

	Dick Datchery was played by Alice Nutting but wasn't the real Dick Datchery. They vote on who it is later in the show.

questions.text: Complete the line from "Don't Quit While You're Ahead". "Don't let the moment go to waste, not with __________ close enough to taste."
questions.explanation:
victory.

	"Heed the call with all due haste."

questions.text: By the end of the show, is Edwin Drood dead or alive?
questions.explanation:
dead.

	In the play, the cast gets to vote on this one, and they all vote her dead, mainly because the cast doesn't like Alice Nutting who plays Drood.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a choice for Dick Datchery?
questions.explanation:
Edwin Drood.

	Edwin Drood can't be a choice cause he's dead by this point in the show.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a choice for the murderer?
questions.explanation:
Deputy.

	Jasper can be voted on, but will never win. There's no song for him, and the entire time it ran on Broadway they never had the problem with him getting the most votes. It's too obvious an answer to pick him.

questions.text: Compete the lyrics to "The Writing on the Wall": "Try to live forever, and give up _________."
questions.explanation:
never.

	This song is song by Edwin Drood who's returned from the grave. The show was writen by Rupert Holmes. He did both the music and the lyrics. I hope you enjoyed my quiz.
